results.title: Stories from a flying trunk
results.creator_credit: EMI/Parlophone, John Brabourne, Richard Goodwin and Christine Edzard
results.brief_description: Entertaining children’s film combining the use of live action, animation and ballet to present adaptations of three Hans Christian Andersen fairytales - The Kitchen, The Little match girl and Little Ida - where nanimate kitchen objects come alive, vegetables stage a ballet and magic fills the air. Featuring members of the Royal Ballet, including Lesley Collier (Princess Ida), Graham Fletcher and Denise Nunn with choreography by Frederick Ashton, music by Rossini arranged by John Dalby and conducted by Philip Gammon. Cast also includes Murray Melvin, Ann Firbank, John Tordoff, John Dalby, Patricia Napier, Tasneem Maqsood (the match girl), Johanna Sonnex (Ida).

results.title: Stories for Everyone
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Dorothy Butler’s Video Books”.
A video designed to encourage children to read and enjoy books. Ten different stories, many from well known books, are told by professional storytellers and have been selected for children aged five to eight years old.

results.title: Stories at school = Alastair's elephant and nine other stories at school
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Dorothy Butler’s Video Books”.
A video designed to encourage children to read and enjoy books. Ten different stories, many from well known books, are told by professional storytellers and have been selected for children aged five to eight years old. The stories are: Mr. Tick the teacher, Look what I’ve got, Gumdrop: the adventures of a vintage car, Tinker, tailor, soldier, sailor, Sick cow, The House that grew, Alistair’s elephant, Kimi and the watermelon, How St. Francis tamed the wolf, The Bossing of Josie. Introduced by Dorothy Butler.

results.title: Stories and songs of the people: they came for gathering (A)
results.creator_credit: f-reel, ABC-TV (Australia). Indigenous Program Unit, Indigenous Unit, AFC, Johnnie Aseron and Fiona Cochrane
results.brief_description: This video documents the first ‘Stories and songs of the people’ event held in Australia at the Forum theatre, Melbourne in 1999. This event was organised by “grass roots” community and gave the opportunity for many Aboriginal and non-Aboriginal artists to express a collective future through music. It’s aim was to create a cultural and educational exchange with other Indigenous groups from around the globe. bearing in mind similarities which exist between some Indigenous peoples, eg the Native American and the Australian Aborigine’s colonisation and dispossession, their traditional links to the land and the loss of their identity. Music is seen as a healing process towards reconciliation. Performing artists include Frankie Yamma, Peter Rotumah, Deb Morrow, Kelli Howell, Neil Murray & Stephen Teakle, Shane Howard, Illana Atkinson, Tom E. Lewis, Tiffany Eckardt & Dave Steel, Nick larkins, Lee Morgan, Russell Smith, Malcolm Jagamuarra and visiting Native American artist Johnnie Aseron. Video support notes included.

results.title: Stories and songs of the people: the second stage
results.creator_credit: Johnnie Aseron, Film Victoria, F-Reel Pty Ltd and Fiona Cochrane
results.brief_description: Participants in the Stories and Songs of the People weekend tell their personal stories and provide a perspective on living in a world dominated by white culture. The struggles of indigenous peoples in Australia and some other parts of the world are explored through these individual experiences. A selection of music and songs performed during the weekend provide a backdrop to the discussion.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Johnnie Aseron, Film Victoria, F-Reel Pty Ltd and Fiona Cochrane

results.title: Stories afloat = lighthouse keeper's lunch
results.creator_credit: Gerben Cath and International Video Books
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Dorothy Butler’s Video Books”.
A video designed to encourage children to read and enjoy books. Ten different stories, many from well known books, are told by Dorothy Butler and Don Kjestrup as they take a group of children for a sail in a yacht. The stories have been selected for children aged eight to eleven years old. The stories are: “A bag of wind”, The magic apple”, Scruffy, scruffy dog”, “Mrs. Vineagar” “Shuttle burn”, “Mrs. McGinty and the bizarre plant”, “Gumdrop and the farmer’s friend”, “Pelican”, “Rapunzel” and “The lighthouse keeper’s lunch”
results.description:

results.title: Stories
results.brief_description:
Shows children working with a teacher and making up a round-robin collaborative story, formulating characters, illustrating how they get ideas, and the importance of settings, beginnings and endings.
Suitable for primary level.

results.title: Stopping the coming ice age
results.brief_description: Probably the most important video many of us will ever see. Record cold winters and record summer heat and drought, increasing floods, hurricanes and tornadoes, dying forests, massive fuel burning and the clearcutting of the tropical rainforests are all related. The next Ice Age may be virtually upon us, a natural 100,000 year cycle driven by erosion, the death and rebirth of forests and the rise and fall of greenhouse gases. It has already resulted in massive starvation. If we act quickly we may be able to stop it, if not we may be eating less in seven years.

results.title: Stopover
results.brief_description: Depicts a traveller at a stopover in a bus terminal who demonstrates the possibility of living gourmet style while travelling by Greyhound bus. Raises important questions pertaining to outright theft, consumerism, etc.
